5.4 /r/user/autosave - Reference Documentation

Authors: Microsoft Corporation

Version: 8.0.0

5.4 /r/user/autosave

This call enables or disables the autosave semantics on persistent projects for the duration of the current users HTTP session. By default, all live persistent projects are autosaved under the following conditions:
  • When a user closes a project using the /r/project/close call.
  • When a user signs-out using the /r/user/logout call.
  • When a user is automatically signed-out by the system after a prolonged period of inactivity.

When the autosave feature is disabled a user must make an explicit call on /r/project/save in order to save a project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on call: json or xml
  • enable – (optional) toggles autosave semantics for persistent projects.

Examples 

format=json
enable=true

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/user/autosave",
            "success": true,
            "user": {
                "username": "george",
                "displayname": "George Best",
                "permissions": {
                    "scriptManager": true,
                    "powerUser": true,
                    "packageManager": true,
                    "administrator": false,
                    "basicUser": true
                },
                "cookie": null
            },
            "limits": {
                "maxIdleLiveProjectTimeout": 1800,
                "maxConcurrentLiveProjectCount": 170,
                "maxFileUploadSize": 268435456
            },
            "whoami": "george",
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/user/autosave</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <user>
      <username>george</username>
      <displayname>George Best</displayname>
      <permissions>
        <administrator/>
        <powerUser>true</powerUser>
        <basicUser>true</basicUser>
        <scriptManager>true</scriptManager>
        <packageManager>true</packageManager>
      </permissions>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
    </user>
    <limits>
      <maxConcurrentLiveProjectCount>170</maxConcurrentLiveProjectCount>
      <maxIdleLiveProjectTimeout>1800</maxIdleLiveProjectTimeout>
      <maxFileUploadSize>268435456</maxFileUploadSize>
    </limits>
    <whoami>george</whoami>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>
